messages.title: Fighting against Hard Brexit
messages.content: Liberal Democrats are the only party that has always fought for Britain’s membership of the European Union, and that’s why we are fighting for you to have your say on the final Brexit deal.

messages.title: Standing up for the NHS
messages.content: We know we need additional investment in health and care services as a matter of urgency. The Horton Hospital is again under threat. The Liberal Democrats would give it the funds it needs.

messages.title: Opposing school cuts
messages.content: Local schools are under threat from a Conservative Party that has stopped listening to local people in Northamptonshire. Secondary schools are set to lose £46 million from their budgets by 2019 which means a cut of some 1,227 teachers.

keyPolicies.policyDescription: Opposing Brexit and advocating for Britain's membership in the European Union. Ensuring a public say on the final Brexit deal.
Additional investment in health and care services, ensuring hospitals like the Horton Hospital get the necessary funding.
Opposing funding cuts to local schools, which threaten to significantly reduce the number of teachers and impact quality of education.
Opposing the proposed Rail Freight Terminal at Blisworth and Milton Malsor, urging for local and national consultations and comprehensive impact reports.
Calling for urgent action on air pollution, particularly addressing the situation caused by the changes in traffic around Towcester.
